Digital India Program is a revolutionary step taken by the Government of India on July 2, 2015. It is an Umbrella Programme which includes various on-line services under a single initiative. It is focusing on providing digital infrastructure in every corner of the country so that citizens can get service on-demand. It is improving the way services are being delivered to common people and businesses are conducted. Citizens no longer have to wait in long queues to get their work done. Meritorious and needy students are getting financial support for their studies. Hence, it is proving to be a boon for the citizens by bringing digital transformation in the country.

Indian government has implemented Biometric Attendance System (BAS) in the central government offices located in Delhi in 2015. It enables an employee to register attendance by presenting his/her biometric (finger print/iris) which are authenticated on-line by doing one to one match with the biometrics stored in the UIDAI database against the employee’s Aadhaar number.

This system service is leading India towards better future by ensuring full transparency and increased work efficiency of the government employees.
\n1. Visit URL or click here.\n

2. Register to get an Attendance ID.

3. Enter the 6-digit Attendance ID in biometric machine.

4. A Red light will glow on Fingerprint Scanner.

5. Put the finger on the Fingerprint Scanner.

6. Once “Authenticating, Please Wait” shows on your screen. Remove finger from the scanner.

7. A pop-up screen will show your Photo and Attendance Type as “OPENING” for marking attendance for first time of the day.

8. In case Attendance Type is “CLOSING” then it is counted as Out Time.

9. If a CROSS is shown instead of your photo, it means some ERROR has occurred.

\nWorkshops are being organized regularly on Aadhaar enabled Biometric attendance system to help employees understand the management of attendance portal and devices available in their organization. These workshops include a practical experience of all relevant information.\n

Government of India has digitalized many services, one of the key initiative launched in February, 2015, is Digital Locker which provides a dedicated personal electronic space for storing documents (maximum 1 GB) to resident Indian citizens. This is linked to their Aadhaar number and the space can be utilized for storing personal documents (University Certificates, PAN cards, Voter ID cards) and the URI's of the e-documents issued by various issuer departments.

It minimizes the use of physical documents and provides authenticity and security to the e-documents.
\n1. Visit URL or click here. \n

2. Click on sign up button.

3. Fill up details:

a. Enter your mobile number.

b. Enter OTP generated on mobile (valid for 30 mins).

c. Choose a user name and password.

d. Click on sign up button. This creates the DigiLocker account.

e. You may link the DigiLocker account with Aadhaar card. This is optional.

e-Sign (Electronic Signature) authenticates digital document and ensures that it's contents can't be changed further. It has same legal value as physical signature on paper. Anyone can acquire e-sign by using Aadhaar card and a registered mobile number. 

A digital signature is different from an e-sign, an individual has to apply for Digital signature. The certifying authority then issues certificate after validating the credentials submitted in the application form. This Digital Signature certificate (stored in USB) is valid for 2-3 years.

(Currently only DigiLocker allows to acquire e-Sign on a document)

1. Visit URL or click here,

and Login to DigiLocker website via Aadhaar Card number.

2. Upload the document to be e-Signed.

3. Click on the e-sign icon to generate an online request for signature.

4. Enter Aadhaar Number again.

5. The request is then verified by the Aadhaar e-KYC.

6. An OTP (One Time Password) is sent to the user’s registered mobile no.

7. After validating through the OTP, an online e-Sign is issued immediately.

As part of the Digital India initiative, Indian Government launched e-Basta service to provide e-books and other study material to school students all over the country. The e-Basta project provides a framework to make school books accessible in digital form to the students. A portal has been provided to bring various publishers and schools together on a single platform. 

In addition, an app is provided to facilitate organization and easy management of digital resources on mobile phones.
\n\u2022 Access e-Basta from any android based tablet or mobile phone via e-Basta App or by visiting the e-Basta portal directly by clicking here.\n
\n\u2022 Create an account via register link and login.\n\u2022 Create e-Basta

o Click on Search e-Content menu to find e-Books based on class & subject and select it.
o Add it into your cart and create e-Basta.
o Give a unique name to the e-Basta & share with students.

• Search for required e-Basta or e-Content and select it.
• Buy (if not free) the selected e-Basta or e-Content.
• Click on the provided link and download the e-Basta.

Currently e-Basta has 329 NCERT textbooks (in e-book format) for classes 1 to 12 in Hindi, English, Urdu, and Sanskrit.

Government launched e-Scholarship service under Digital India Program in July 2015. The scholarship provides financial help to the poor and meritorious students to enable them to pursue professional and technical courses. It is specially devised to help students belonging to notified minority communities like Muslim/Christian/Sikh/Buddhist/Jain/Parsi studying in India.

One of the key features of the scheme is that 30% of scholarship is earmarked for the girl student. The service portal provides all scheme related information including criteria and eligibility. All the documents are submitted and verified on-line.
\n1. Visit URL or click here.\n

2. Click on the register icon, and fill the details.

3. Shortly a temporary id will be created. Click to proceed.

4. Fill the personal and academic details, eligible schemes will be shown.

5. Select a scheme, attach the desired documents and fill in the bank details.

6. Fill the contact details after completion of which you will get a permanent Id.

7. The Id can be used to track the status of your application.

MyGov, the brainchild of Modi government, was launched in July, 2014. It is a citizen engagement platform managed by Ministry of Electronics and Information Technology and National Informatics Centre. It offers various services to citizens and invites suggestions to improve and strengthen it.

It also allows people to participate in multiple theme-based discussions, share their ideas and thoughts and contribute towards good governance.
\n1. Visit URL or click here.\n

2. Click at sign in.

3. Enter your full name, email address on the create a MyGov account page and select country.

4. Enter your contact number.

5. Select your gender and enter your date of birth.

6. Then click on create new account.

Pension provides income and sustainability to a retired employee. Indian government launched digital life certificate called Jeevan Pramaan Certificate for pensioners under Digital India program in November 2014. It is issued to individual pensioners using their biometric credentials. 

Pensioners then provide the certificate to an authorized pension disbursing agency like bank, following which their pension is credited to their account.
\n1. Visit nearest Jeevan Pramaan centre and register online for a nominal fees. Locate it using\n

or via mobile by sending an SMS JPL <Pincode> to (7738299899). 

2. Install Jeevan Pramaan software available on

on either windows based desktop or android based smart-phone and use a biometric device and details like Aadhaar No., PPO No., Bank A/c No. and Branch details to register.

3. After a valid registration, a unique Jeevan Pramaan ID is generated and sent to the mobile number. Bank is then informed about it. This process is repeated each year in November.

Modi Government developed e-hospital portal as part of Digital India program and extended it to the country's health-care system. Many premier hospitals of India including All India Institute of Medical Sciences (AIIMS), Ram Manohar Lohia (RML) Hospital and National Institute of Mental Health, have been covered under it.

 It allows citizens to book appointments for OPD check-ups, get lab reports on-line, check availability of various blood types, and make on-line payment. This has increased transparency of public health-care system and utilization of services, and has reduced waiting time to a large extent.

e-Greetings stands for electronic greetings. Its aim is to promote on-line sharing of greetings. It provides an eco-friendly way of sharing greetings on national as well as regional festivals and other special occasions. All citizens who want to share wishes with their colleagues, friends and relatives can easily use this service. 

e-Greetings portal has a huge collection of greeting cards, so a user can send greetings as per his choice. The portal allows sender to write customized messages and upload audio, video in the card.
\n1. Visit URL or click here.\n

2. Click on sign in button and sign in using either Google/Facebook/MyGov/Twitter account.

3. Search the event and select the type of card.

4. Select the quotes and messages or manually type the messages.

5. Click on submit.

6. Enter the details of sender and recipients.

7. Click on send.
